text:
FWIW, you can indeed apply a Cumulative update to the Winre.wim image on top of
the Safe OS update, it will apply just fine. It's not required in the MSFT
documentation related to offline updating the WinRE image, so it might no be
critical, but it does update a bunch of files in System32, so... :) Best
regards, Florian Stosse Cybersecurity engineer Galileo Project Office |
Directorate of Navigation European Space Research and Technology Centre (ESTEC)
| European Space Agency

metadata.topic: Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.email_text_original:
[Vous ne recevez pas souvent de courriers de florian.stosse@esa.int. Découvrez
pourquoi ceci est important à https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ]
FWIW, you can indeed apply a Cumulative update to the Winre.wim image on top of
the Safe OS update, it will apply just fine. It's not required in the MSFT
documentation related to offline updating the WinRE image, so it might no be
critical, but it does update a bunch of files in System32, so... :) Best
regards, Florian Stosse Cybersecurity engineer Galileo Project Office |
Directorate of Navigation European Space Research and Technology Centre (ESTEC)
| European Space Agency -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of Abbodii Sent: Wednesday, January
24, 2024 3:23 AM To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: Re:
[patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and
what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused) Winre.wim gets
updated with the companion Safe OS dynamic update, not the cumulative update
itself
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fkb5034234-compatibility-update-for-installing-and-recovering-windows-11-version-22h2-and-23h2-january-9-2024-045d389d-8bd5-4e3b-8772-afaf0a1cbb9e&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C8cfbce4f0dd249fa5e1308dc1cbc99f1%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638416844415235199%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C62000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ILW1c%2F4jJ0i89gq8yI1GmyAStMl8ZkFv1DGa%2FFzmkzI%3D&reserved=0
On 1/24/24, 'Susan Bradley' via PatchManagement wrote:
Link: None
